content:
Introduction


Software development is the process of designing, creating, testing, and maintaining applications, frameworks, and other software components.


software components.
name: UM-00001
title: Introduction to Software Development

content: SDLC is a structured process that ensures the quality and correctness of software development. It includes phases such as Planning, Design, Development, Testing, Deployment, and Maintenance.
name: UM-00002
title: Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)

content: Various programming languages like Python, JavaScript, Java, and C++ are used in software development, each with its strengths and weaknesses.
name: UM-00003
title: Programming Languages Overview

content: Version control systems like Git help developers track and manage changes to their code. Tools like GitHub, GitLab, and Bitbucket enhance collaboration.
name: UM-00004
title: Version Control with Git

content: Agile focuses on iterative development, flexibility, and collaboration, while Waterfall follows a linear and structured approach.
name: UM-00005
title: Agile vs Waterfall Methodologies

content: Debugging is an essential part of software development. Tools like Chrome DevTools, VS Code Debugger, and Postman help developers identify and fix issues.
name: UM-00006
title: Debugging Techniques

content: APIs (Application Programming Interfaces) allow software applications to communicate. REST and GraphQL are common API types used in web and mobile apps.
name: UM-00007
title: Introduction to APIs

content: Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Deployment (CD) streamline the development lifecycle. DevOps practices improve collaboration between developers and IT teams.
name: UM-00008
title: Deployment & DevOps Basics

content: Secure coding practices, encryption, authentication, and penetration testing are crucial to protect applications from cyber threats.
name: UM-00009
title: Security in Software Development

content: Databases like MySQL, PostgreSQL, and MongoDB store and retrieve data efficiently for applications. SQL and NoSQL are the two main types of databases.
name: UM-00010
title: Database Management
